pl.wkr.fluentrule.api

Class FluentExpectedException

  • java.lang.Object
    • pl.wkr.fluentrule.api.FluentExpectedException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TestRule

    public class FluentExpectedException
extends Object
    Implements junit's expected exception rule in fluent way, returning AssertJ ThrowableAssert.

    Usage in tests: 

    
  @Rule
  public FluentExpectedException thrown = FluentExpectedException.none();

  @Test
  public void fluent_rule_any_exception() {
      thrown.expect().hasMessage("exc").hasNoCause();
      throw new IllegalStateException("exc");
  }
    Author:
    Wojciech Krak
    See Also:
    Project site - more examples

      • expectWith

        public <A extends AbstractThrowableAssert<A,T>,T extends Throwable> A expectWith(Class<A> assertClass)
        Starts expecting exception and return custom throwable assert to specify expectations on exception. Method take class of any custom implementation of AbstractThrowableAssert and returns proxy of it, to allow specify expectations on thrown exception.
        Type Parameters:
        A - class of custom throwable assert
        T - class of throwables supported by custom throwable assert
        Parameters:
        assertClass - class of custom throwable assert, subclass of AbstractThrowableAssert
        Returns:
        instance of custom throwable assert to specify more expectations on exception
